isis.stitle: CAB: 7000 AND 8000 SERIES MODELS - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB SQUARING

svcproc.title: CAB SQUARING
svcproc.para: Cab squaring is the centering and perpendicular positioning of the cab structure to the frame. The cab must be squared whenever the cab has been removed from the chassis for repair, or if a new cab is being mounted. It is important to properly square the cab to avoid interference between the cab, hood, and sleeper box and to provide acceptable appearance of the components.

note.para: Ensure chassis is on a level surface before squaring.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. EQUAL DIMENSION EACH SIDE OF CAB

step1.para: Center cab on frame rail by using equal distance between cab frame rail and cab cowl on each side.

note.para: There are no adjustments available to make the cab back panel parallel and perpendicular to the frame.
